inputs.note:
Patient: Ama Osei
DOB: 06/25/1962 | MRN: MRN-4401

Subjective: 64F kidney transplant recipient (2019) presents with oral thrush and vaginal candidiasis. Reports white oral patches x5 days, vaginal itching.

PMH: Renal transplant (living donor 2019), Hyperlipidemia, Type 2 Diabetes, Hypertension
Allergies: None known

Objective:
  Vitals: BP 132/78, HR 72, Temp 37.1°C
  Oral: White plaques on buccal mucosa, palate — scrapes off to reveal erythematous base
  Transplant graft: Non-tender, no bruit changes

Assessment: Oropharyngeal and vulvovaginal candidiasis in immunosuppressed transplant recipient

Plan: Start Diflucan 200mg PO Day 1, then 100mg daily x 14 days. Continue current immunosuppression and statin. Recheck LFTs and tacrolimus level in 1 week.
inputs.labs:
Tacrolimus level: 8.2 ng/mL (therapeutic)
Creatinine: 1.4 mg/dL (stable)
HbA1c: 7.8%
LDL: 118 mg/dL
LFTs: AST 22, ALT 28 (normal)
inputs.meds:
Tacrolimus 3mg PO BID
Mycophenolate 500mg PO BID
Prednisone 5mg PO Daily
Lipitor 40mg PO Daily
Diflucan 200mg PO (NEW — loading dose)
Metformin 1000mg PO BID
Amlodipine 10mg PO Daily
